Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Ari Spiegel, First Roumanian American Congregation, 89 Rivington Street, New York, N.Y.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gerson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Ari Spiegel, First Roumanian American Congregation, 89 Rivington Street, New York, N.Y. 

Council Member Gerson moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 5, 2004 be adopted and printed by Council Member Fidler.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Fidler moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 5, 2004 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor  -  "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the employment of hearing examiners by a parking violations bureau in the city of New York." A.8696-B / S.5349-B
Items.MatterName: Employment of hearing examiners by a parking violations bureau in NYC (A.8696-B/S.5349-B)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 137-B, in relation to the provision of equal employment benefits to the employees of city contractors.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment of Chereé Antoinette Buggs as a member of the New York City Equal Employment Practices Commission.
Items.MatterName: Chereé Antoinette Buggs, Equal Employment Practices Commission.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Provenzano:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 41 City Island Avenue, Borough of the Bronx, Council District no. 13, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20045533 TCX.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 41 City Island Avenue, Bronx (20045533TCX)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Reyna:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 338 Bedford Avenue., Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 34, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20045473 TCK.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 338 Bedford Avenue, Brooklyn (20045473TCK)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5931, and Assembly Member Weprin, A.9417, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to sell and convey certain property to Yeshiva Har Torah”.
Items.MatterName: Sell and convey certain property to Yeshiva Har Torah (S.5931, A.9417)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Maltese, Golden, Padavan and Velella, S.2221-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Cymbrowitz, Ortiz, Pheffer, Rivera, Seddio, Weisenberg, Colton Cusick and Klein, et al, A.4828-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the crediting of certain prior service by the police pension fund of such city ”.
Items.MatterName: Crediting of certain prior service by the police pension fund (S.2221-A, A.4828-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez, Padavan and Velella, S.4186-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7163-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund”.
Items.MatterName: Loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund (S.4186-A, A.7163-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2899, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.3087, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designation of deputy warden (warden level II) in the department of correction of the city of New York”.
Items.MatterName: Designation of deputy warden (warden level II) in the department of correction (S.2899, A.3087)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Sampson, S.4347-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8433-A, “AN ACT to amend chapter 341 of the laws of 2002, relating to authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Richard Bothwell, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3868, Lots No. 20 and 22 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn also known as 891-895 Mother Gaston Boulevard in the borough of Brooklyn, in relation to identifying the correct former owner of such real property as Carol Ajoku”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Carol Ajoku, Brooklyn (S.4347-B, A.8433-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.4258-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8668-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police and fire department personnel”.
Items.MatterName: Employment of retired New York city police and fire department personnel (S.4258-A, A.8668-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Smith, S.6685, and Assembly Member Clark, A.10485, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner Tiberian Baptist Church, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 10950, Lot No. 161 on tax map for the borough of Queens”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Tiberian Baptist Church, Brooklyn (S.6685, A.10485)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7015, and Committee on Rules, A.11043, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to providing a special accidental death benefit to emergency medical technicians employed in the city of New York”.
Items.MatterName: Providing a special accidental death benefit to emergency medical technicians (S.7015, A.11043)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7159, and Committee on Rules, A.11042, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the retirement and social security law, in relation to providing improved ordinary death benefits to emergency medical technicians employed in the city of New York”.
Items.MatterName: Providing improved ordinary death benefits to emergency medical technicians (S.7159, A.11042)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7017, and Committee on Rules, A.11041, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to providing a three-quarters pay accidental disability pension for persons employed by the city of New York as urban park rangers and associate urban park rangers”.
Items.MatterName: Providing a three-quarters pay accidental disability pension (S.7017, A.11041)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7014, and Committee on Rules, A.11040, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the retirement and social security law, in relation to providing improved performance of duty death benefits to emergency medical technicians employed in the city of New York”.
Items.MatterName: Providing improved performance of duty death benefits to emergency medical technicians (S.7014, A.11040)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez, Padavan and Velella, S.6699, and Committee on Rules, A.10883, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including in a twenty-five year retirement program members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as traffic enforcement agents (level 4); and to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to including in a twenty-five year retirement program members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as traffic enforcement agents (level 4) who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of such law”.
Items.MatterName: Including in a twenty-five year retirement program members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as traffic enforcement agents (S.6699, A.10883)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6108, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7174-A, “AN ACT to make certain widows and children of certain former uniformed employees of New York city police departments eligible for special accidental death benefits pursuant to section 208-f of the general municipal law”.
Items.MatterName: Make certain widows and children of certain former uniformed employees of New York city police departments eligible for special accidental death benefits (S.6108, A.7174-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.7334, and Committee on Rules, A.11280, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to additional member contributions by employees of the department of sanitation in cities having a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Additional member contributions by employees of the department of sanitation (S.7334, A.11280)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to approve S.50, the Veterans Health Care Guarantee Act, and H.R. 2318, the Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act, which would institute a mandatory funding mechanism for the Department of Veterans Affairs health care system.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Approve S.50, the Veterans Health Care Guarantee Act, and H.R. 2318.

Items.Title: General Order Calendar
Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter to require that the department of homeless services give notice, before developing, planning, rehabilitating or engaging in a contract to develop transitional housing and services, to the council member for the district in which such transitional housing and services are to be located, to the president of the borough in which such transitional housing and services are to be located, to the community board for the district in which such transitional housing and services are to be located and to the department of city planning.
Items.MatterName: Dept of Homeless Services give notice to Council Members.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring cameras on all commuter buses operating exclusively within New York City.
Items.MatterName: Requiring cameras on all commuter buses operating exclusively within NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and New York City Transit and the Manhattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority to install cameras on all its buses.
Items.MatterName: MTA and NYC Transit and the Manhattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority to install cameras on all its buses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to the energy efficient use of City office equipment.
Items.MatterName: Energy efficient use of City office equipment.

Items.Title: Resolution urging Congress and the President to take immediate steps to ensure that WIC is adequately funded to meet caseload needs for the remainder of the current Federal Fiscal Year ending September 30, 2004, and calling on the Federal Government to ensure that WIC participants in New York City and across the nation are not placed on waiting lists or cut from this critical nutrition and health program for Federal Fiscal Year 2005 and beyond.
Items.MatterName: Ensure that WIC is adequately funded to meet caseload needs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the purchase of Energy Star certified appliances whenever appliances in certain apartments are replaced.
Items.MatterName: Purchase of Energy Star certified appliances whenever appliances in rental apartments are replaced.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to collective bargaining rights of certain city employees.
Items.MatterName: Collective bargaining rights of certain city employees.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the month of June 2004, and the month of June of every year thereafter, as Water Safety Month in the City of New York and urging all New Yorkers and visitors, who plan to be near any water source, to apply water safety measures to prevent drownings and water-related injuries.
Items.MatterName: Water Safety Month in the City of New York, June 2004

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mitigating the heat island effect.
Items.MatterName: Mitigating the heat island effect.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a survey regarding clean on-site power generation for city facilities.
Items.MatterName: A survey regarding clean on-site power generation for city facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a program regarding building commissioning and energy efficiency and conservation training.
Items.MatterName: Creation of a program regarding building commissioning and energy efficiency and conservation training.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of license plate frames.
Items.MatterName: Use of license plate frames.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to adopt and the Governor to sign A 3723-B and S 3963-B, which would eliminate the current cap contained in the State Real Property Tax Law on State aid to the City for maintaining a system of improved real property tax administration.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the current cap contained in the State Real Property Tax Law on State aid to the City for maintaining a system of improved real property tax administration (A.3723-B/S.3963-B)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon President Bush and the United States Congress to eliminate the shortfall in funding for Section 8 Housing Choice Vouchers and to restore full funding for Fiscal Year 2004.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the shortfall in funding for Section 8 Housing Choice Vouchers.

Items.Title: Resolution strongly denouncing the crimes committed against civilian populations in the western region of Darfur and the actions of the government of Sudan in connection with those crimes, and urging the government of the United States to take immediate action to support the implementation of a United Nations multi-national peace-keeping force and humanitarian relief effort to end the reign of terror that exists in that region.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the crimes committed against civilian populations in the western region of Darfur .

Items.Title: Resolution in support of S.1359, the “International Remittances Services Enhancement and Protection Act,” to remove the regulatory barriers that discourage credit unions from offering services to the poor and to require full disclosure of the fees and exchange rates to consumers, and S.1344, the “Money Wire Act,” to mandate greater transparency in the money wiring process.
Items.MatterName: International Remittances Services Enhancement and Protection Act

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the use of torture and other inhumane treatment of Iraqi prisoners and detainees by some members of the United States Armed Forces and other American personnel at the Abu Ghraib prison near Baghdad, and urging the United States Congress to conduct a full and open investigation of the abuse at the Abu Ghraib prison and to adopt legislation affirming a no tolerance of torture policy that would hold accountable violators, as well as the supervisors of any violators, of the human right to not be subjected to torture or other cruel, inhumane treatment or punishment.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the use of torture and other inhumane treatment of Iraqi prisoners and detainees by some members of the US Armed Forces and other American personnel at the Abu Ghraib prison.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to creating an energy shortage contingency plan.
Items.MatterName: Creating an energy shortage contingency plan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the creation of an energy office and public awareness city-wide of energy efficiency and conservation measures.
Items.MatterName: Creation of an energy office and public awareness city-wide of energy efficiency and conservation measures.

Items.Title: Resolution granting additional real property tax exemptions for certain affordable housing developments.
Items.MatterName: Extending real property tax exemptions for certain affordable housing developments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon government officials to protect and uphold First Amendment rights to freedom of speech, association and assembly.
Items.MatterName: Government officials to protect and uphold First Amendment rights to freedom of speech, association and assembly.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the passage of H.R. 3735, legislation introduced by Congressman Rangel that would grant permanent residency to the immediate family members of Amadou Diallo.
Items.MatterName: Grant permanent residency to the immediate family members of Amadou Diallo.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the “Berlin Declaration,” a document summary of the second international conference on anti-Semitism recently held by the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Supporting the "Berlin Declaration"

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold a hearing to examine the role that the sale of used mattresses play in the recent surge in bedbug infestations.
Items.MatterName: Examine the role that the sale of used mattresses play in the recent surge in bedbug infestations.

Items.Title: Resolution finding that enactment of Proposed Int. No. 126-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with the state environmental quality review act.
Items.MatterName: Proposed Int. No. 126-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.7290-A, and Committee on Rules, A.11216-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the definitions of final average salary for certain employees”.
Items.MatterName: Definitions of final average salary for certain employees (S.7290-A, A.11216-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Committee on Rules, A.11045, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, in relation to permitting police personnel to accept other offices and to repeal section 1129 of such charter relating thereto”.
Items.MatterName: Permitting police personnel to accept other offices (A.11045)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Maltese, Marchi and Mendez, S.1475, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Pheffer, Seddio, Weisenberg, et al, A.3156, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police personnel”.
Items.MatterName: Employment of retired New York city police personnel (S.1475, A.3156)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Skelos, S.2660-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Seddio, M. Cohen and Klein, et al, A.4430-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to benefits payable by the variable supplements funds”.
Items.MatterName: Benefits payable by the variable supplements funds (S.2660-A, A.4430-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6108, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7174-A, “AN ACT to make certain widows and children of certain former uniformed employees of New York city police departments eligible for special accidental death benefits pursuant to section 208-f of the general municipal law”.
Items.MatterName: Make certain widows and children of certain former uniformed employees of New York city police departments eligible for special accidental death benefits (S.6108, A.7174-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Dilan, S.7233, and Committee on Rules, A.11069, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use of certain lands as park lands”.
Items.MatterName: Discontinue the use of certain lands as park lands (S.7233, A.11069)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.7280, and Committee on Rules, A.11217, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to terminal leave”.
Items.MatterName: Terminal leave (S.7280, A.11217)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Committee on Rules, A.8911, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain tow truck operators to acquire certain proof before towing a vehicle”.
Items.MatterName: Requiring certain tow trucks operators to acquire certain proof before towing a vehicle (A.8911)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7154, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10279, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to provisional appointments”.
Items.MatterName: Provisional appointments (S.7154, A.10279)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer, A.6794-A, “AN ACT to assign Johanna Kaplan to the proper pension plan in the New York city teachers’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Assign Johanna Kaplan to the proper pension plan (A.6794-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.7334, and Committee on Rules, A.11280, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to additional member contributions by employees of the department of sanitation in cities having a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Additional member contributions by employees of the department of sanitation (S.7334, A.11280)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to repeal State Law which currently bans the passage of local dangerous dog legislation that is specific as to breed, so that New York City may ban the ownership or sale of dangerous dogs, including pit bulls, within the City.
Items.MatterName: Passage of local dangerous dog legislation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to increase the criminal penalties for driving with a suspended license.
Items.MatterName: Increase the criminal penalties for driving with a suspended license.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the fees charged for applications filed with the board of standards and appeals.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the fees charged for applications filed with the board of standards and appeals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fees for firearms licenses and rifle and shotgun permits.
Items.MatterName: Fees for firearms licenses and rifle and shotgun permits.

Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for Municipal Park projects, Local Waterfront Revitalization Projects, and Hudson River Estuary projects within the City of New York and the signing of associated state contracts under the appropriate laws of New York State.
Items.MatterName: Filing of applications for state assistance payments for Municipal Park projects, Local Waterfront Revitalization Projects, and Hudson River Estuary projects within the NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing an affordability requirement for an increase in residential density in multiple dwellings.
Items.MatterName: Imposing an affordability requirement for an increase in residential density in multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including candidates for justice of the supreme court, surrogate’s court or civil court in the New York City voluntary Campaign Finance Program.
Items.MatterName: Including candidates for justice of the supreme court, surrogate's court or civil court in the NYC voluntary Campaign Finance Program.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: SLR No. 1 and Res No. 370-A.  See files for individual votes.
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motions which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting acts of harassment at schools.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting acts of harassment at schools.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment of Chereé Antoinette Buggs as a member of the New York City Equal Employment Practices Commission.
Items.MatterName: Chereé Antoinette Buggs, Equal Employment Practices Commission.
